Utterance: <synch>
Hi! It’s great to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hey, Ellie! I’ve been doing better, actually. I started journaling like we talked about.
That’s wonderful! How has that experience been for you?
It’s been really helpful. Writing down my thoughts has cleared my head a lot. I didn’t realize how much I was holding in.
That’s great to hear! Did you notice any recurring themes in your entries?
Yeah, I keep writing about my fears regarding my music and my future. It’s like I can’t escape those thoughts.
It’s understandable. Those fears can be persistent. Have you been able to challenge any of those fears through your journaling?
A little bit. I wrote about how I’ve faced challenges before and come out okay. It made me feel stronger.
That’s an excellent insight! Recognizing your resilience is very important. How does that change your perspective on your current fears?
It makes me realize that I’ve overcome obstacles before, so I can handle this too. I just need to keep reminding myself.
Absolutely! Self-affirmation can be a powerful tool. Have you tried any affirmations?
Not really, but I’m open to it. What do you suggest?
You could start with something simple, like “I am capable of achieving my dreams.” You can write it down or say it out loud to yourself.
I like that! I’ll give it a try.
Great! Now, how has your music been going? Any new projects?
I started working on a new song. I’m feeling more inspired lately, which is nice.
That’s fantastic! What’s the song about?
It’s about my journey and the struggles I’ve faced. I think it’s a way to process everything.
That sounds powerful! Creating art from your experiences can be very healing. How does working on this song make you feel?
It feels liberating. I’m finally putting my emotions into something tangible.
That’s a beautiful way to express yourself. Have you shared it with anyone yet?
Not yet. I’m a bit nervous about what they’ll think.
It’s normal to feel vulnerable when sharing your art. Would you consider sharing it with someone you trust?
I think I could share it with my girlfriend. She’s always supportive.
That sounds like a good idea. Having a support system can help ease those fears. How do you think she would react?
I think she’d love it. She always encourages me, so I should just go for it.
Exactly! Sometimes, taking that leap can lead to unexpected positive feedback. Is there anything else you’d like to work on today?
I guess I’m still struggling with sleep. It hasn’t improved much.
I’m sorry to hear that. Have you been able to try any techniques we discussed?
I’ve been trying to meditate before bed, but my mind still races.
That can be tough. How about we explore some relaxation techniques specifically for bedtime?
Sure, I’m open to that.
One technique is progressive muscle relaxation. It involves tensing and then relaxing each muscle group. Would you like to try it now?
Yeah, let’s do it.
Great! Start by taking a deep breath in... hold it... and now exhale. Now, let’s tense your feet for a few seconds... and relax. How does that feel?
It feels nice. I can feel the tension leave a little.
Perfect! You can do this with each muscle group, working your way up to your head. It can help signal to your body that it’s time to unwind.
I’ll definitely try that tonight.
I’m glad to hear that! Let’s check in on your progress with sleep next time. Anything else on your mind today?
No, I think we covered everything. I feel good about the journaling and the music.
That’s wonderful! I’m proud of you for taking those steps. Keep up the great work, and I look forward to hearing about your progress next session.
Thanks, Ellie. I appreciate your support!
You’re welcome! Take care, and see you soon.
Bye!
